chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: The OpenStack Security Guide is the result of a five day sprint of collaborative work of many individuals. The purpose of this document is to provide the best practice guidelines for deploying a secure OpenStack cloud. It is a living document that is updated as new changes are merged into the repository, and is meant to reflect the current state of security within the OpenStack community and provide frameworks for decision making where listing specific security controls are not feasible due to complexity or other environment specific details.
